message.content:
cs.DB, cs.PL, cs.IR, cs.DL, cs.SE. 

The paper discusses the implementation of XPath language in logic programming for querying XML documents. This involves representing XML documents using logic programs, indexing XML documents in logic programs, and querying using XPath expressions against a logic program representing an XML document. These topics are relevant to several sub-categories of computer science, including databases (cs.DB), programming languages (cs.PL), information retrieval (cs.IR), data mining (cs.DL), and software engineering (cs.SE). However, since the paper focuses on querying and indexing XML documents, cs.DB and cs.PL are the most likely sub-categories, followed by cs.IR, cs.DL, and cs.SE.
